headline: CNN This Morning
subHeadline: Bolsonaro Flees to Florida; Roberts Raises Safety Concerns; Rolling Stone Sparks Debate. Aired 6:30-7a ET

utterances.speaker: JULIA VARGAS JONES, CNN PRODUCER
utterances.sentences: To see, Don, or congratulate his opponent. In fact, he went in the other direction, challenging election results. And his supporters took to the streets demanding a military intervention.Now, he didn't give a reason for his departure - his abrupt departure to Florida on Friday. We know that he meant to skip the inauguration. But he is being investigated in Brazil for a series of things. One of them is the fact that the mishandling of the Covid-19 pandemic. He's being investigated by Brazil's supreme court. And also there are several allegations of corruption that touched the president and his family. So, a very uncertain future for the former president, if he will stay abroad or return to Brazil to potentially face those charges.

utterances.speaker: DON LEMON, CNN ANCHOR
utterances.sentences: So, the question is, people want to know, I want to know, why did he choose Florida?

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.sentences: Unclear, Don. I couldn't tell you. We know that he has an appreciation for former President Donald Trump. There was -- there were rumors in Brazilian media that he perhaps wanted to go to Mar-a- Lago. That was never confirmed. He is staying at a house of a former MMA fighter. That's what we do know. Unclear why Florida.It's also a place that has a lot of Brazilians. Orlando, huge Brazilian community. He was very well received there when he arrived on Friday evening to cheers and applause. You can see why he's having a good time.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: He has now become a Florida man.Thank you very much, Julia Vargas Jones. Appreciate it.

utterances.speaker: POPPY HARLOW, CNN ANCHOR
utterances.sentences: Well, also this morning, Brazil begins saying a formal good-bye to the king. The global icon, Pele, who put Brazilian soccer on the map in the '60s and the '70s overnight, his coffin was transferred from the hospital where he died to the stadium of his long-time team, Santos, where his wake begins at 8(INAUDIBLE) Pele. He's a legend.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: A legend.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: He's an icon. It was shocking and sad.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: So, the chief justice, John Roberts, expressing his concern for a judge's physical safety after one of the Supreme Court's most tumultuous terms ever.Plus this. (BEGIN VIDEO CLIP) ARETHA FRANKLIN, MUSICIAN (Singing): What you want. Baby, I got it. WHITNEY HOUSTON, MUSICIAN (Singing): The greatest love of all. (END VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Some people are not happy, like my BFF to my left, about "Rolling Stones" list of the 200 greatest singers of all time. The powerhouse vocalist who got left out.Who are you most annoyed about?

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: A judicial system cannot and should not live in fear. That is a quote from the chief justice of the Supreme Court, John Roberts, calling for the safety of judges and justices in his annual year-end report. And this comes as threats against government officials have intensified after the Supreme Court's decision to overturn Roe v. Wade.CNN's senior Supreme Court analyst Joan Biskupic joins us now. It also follows, Joan, the person with a gun outside of Justice Kavanaugh's home just a few months ago. What do you make of the direction and the focus of this for Roberts? I remember a few years it was about making the case that justices are not political. Remember, we're not a Trump court, we're not an Obama court.

utterances.speaker: JOAN BISKUPIC, CNN SENIOR SUPREME COURT ANALYST
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: What do you make about -- of this focus? BISKUPICIt's a - it's a singular opportunity for Chief Justice Roberts to speak to the nation. You know, everybody pays attention to what he says in these year-end reports. And he actually made this year's relatively brief. And even when he talked about safety, it was - it was not in a - in a big way. It was just a couple paragraphs toward the end after detailing threats to a judge back in the '50s during the era of school desegregation cases. So, in some ways, he side stepped the things that people were most thinking about relative to this Supreme Court, the major leak of the decision to reverse Roe v. Wade back in May when the chief said that he was going to launch an investigation of this betrayal of the Supreme Court. Didn't talk at all about that. Didn't talk at all about many of the ethical concerns that have come up in -- on multiple fronts. Remember the Supreme Court doesn't have any kind of formal ethics policy. So, he avoided those things, but he did address the safety issue, which is part of the atmosphere right now.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Justice Kavanaugh and Michigan Governor Gretchen Whitmer are officials who were both targeted this year. So, I want you to take a listen. This is what Whitmer had to say to our Kaitlan Collins. Watch this.(BEGIN VIDEO CLIP) GOV. Gretchen WHITMER (D-MI): And they weren't planning to ransom me. They weren't going to keep me. They were planning to assassinate me. And the plot has been covered as a kidnapping plot. There was one person who showed up on, you know, Supreme Court justice's lawn and turned himself in and it was covered as an assassination attempt. And so I think that when you look at the facts of both of those and you see how differently they're covered, I do, you know, have concern about the language that we use, especially when women are the target as opposed to men. (END VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Does she have a point, Joan?

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: BISKUPIC
utterances.sentences: And that was directed towards her. I - I think that there is no way any of us should diminish what happened to Governor Whitmer, but I also don't want to minimize threats against others. When you think of Nancy Pelosi and her husband, and you think of Dr. Fauci.So, this is a serious concern across the board. Hers, obviously, was really serious. But, again, to go back to the chief justice's report, it was important what he raised, but it was also a missed opportunity to address other things that are so important in the public's eye right now regarding the Supreme Court.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Joan Biskupic, thank you so much.

utterances.speaker: BISKUPIC
utterances.sentences: Thanks.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Appreciate it. Happy New Year to you.

utterances.speaker: BISKUPIC
utterances.sentences: Happy New Year.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: So, there's a growing trend of customers taking food orders that just aren't theirs and they're doing it on purpose. What restaurants and fast-food chains are doing about it, straight ahead.Plus - (BEGIN VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Did you - wait, mom, dad, did you - did you hear this, Michael B. Jordan, dead at 35?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Uh-uh. Uh-uh. Uh-uh. Uh-uh.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Thirty-five.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Uh-uh. Uh-uh.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: No, did you -(END VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: So, this is a trend, but a disturbing one that's going viral on TikTok. Kids pranking their parents, announcing the fake deaths of some of the most beloved public figures. Why one celebrity says it went way too far.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Did -- I saw this and I did not think it was funny.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: It's not.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: You were just listening to three of the top voices from "Rolling Stones" new list of 200 best singers of all time. Topping the list, the late, great Aretha Franklin, the late, great Whitney Houston, Sam Cooke, Billie Holiday, Mariah Carey.Not on the list anywhere, Celine Dion. What? The magazine says it ranked the greatest singers, not necessarily the greatest voices, by originality, influence, depth of their catalog and breath of their musical legacy. Of course, there's plenty of room for debate. So, joining us now, C.J. Farley, he's a former music critic for "Time" magazine, Moses Mendez, a culture reporter for "Time." Hello to both of you. OK. C.J. FARLEY, CULTURAL COMMENTATOR: Hey, thanks for having us. MOISES MENDEZ II, CULTURE REPORTER, "TIME" MAGAZINE: Appreciate it.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: I feel like we're going to have a debate.

utterances.speaker: MENDEZ
utterances.sentences: I feel this (ph).

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: What do you think? Judging by the commercial break we just had.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: I - OK, so I think -- here's what I think. I will let you guys get in. I think the whole thing about voices versus whatever, I think that's a cop out because you can say that people are great performers, but if you say someone is a great singer and a great voice to me, it is the same thing. If you can sing well -- some people just can naturally sing. But there's a different between being a great singer, great voice and a great performer. We will say who I love, Madonna, great performer, right, Janet Jackson, great performer. Do they have the strongest voices? No, but they're great entertainers.Same thing with a Cher or - you can go on and on and on, great entertainers, legends. You cannot. But can they sing like a Whitney Houston or a Luther Vandross or a Mahalia Jackson, who can just open their mouths and music comes out with just by going aahh. No. And I think a lot of those people were left off the list. And you should - that "Rolling Stone," is great cultural influence. And when they think about this, they should take it more seriously and not sort of parse it and say this is voices versus singing, because I think that's a cop out. LEMON: All right. Discuss.

utterances.speaker: FARLEY
utterances.sentences: OK, well, I keep thinking - I keep thinking performing and singing, they're intertwined. And someone like Bob Dylan, who some people might say doesn't have a great voice -

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: It's not. I love Bob Dylan.

utterances.speaker: FARLEY
utterances.sentences: But yet the way -- the way he delivers his lyrics -

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: FARLEY
utterances.sentences: The way he delivers his emotion, he's earned his place on this list.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: FARLEY
utterances.sentences: Yes, this list has a lot of people that are missing. Tracy Chapman should be on this list.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: FARLEY
utterances.sentences: Lucinda Williams from country should be on this list. I think Julian Casablancas, who's with Strokes, should be on this list.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Celine Dion.

utterances.speaker: FARLEY
utterances.sentences: Yes, a lot of people should be on this list. But I think, overall, it's a great list to have because I read last year in "Billboard" that Drake, who's a great rapper, outsells all the catalog artists between -- before 1980. So anyone who's recorded music together, altogether Drake outsells all of them. That's crazy. So, people need to know the history of music. They need to know the history of these vocalists just so they can go through and sample (ph) it.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: What does that mean that Drake - what does that mean that Drake outsells them?

utterances.speaker: FARLEY
utterances.sentences: He sells -

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: He also has - the difference between -- you can be a great rapper and not a great singer, but that's a different category.

utterances.speaker: FARLEY
utterances.sentences: No, but he - but he - he outsells them all together. So, I think people don't know the history of music. They don't buy catalog music before 1980. This list features a lot of people who recorded before 1980, people like Robert Johnson. So, it's great to see them out there and being part of this debate, be part of the discussion because people need to know about theist history of music, the history of vocalists, so that maybe they can sample them and say, oh, maybe this is better than stuff I'm listening to now.So, I love this list. I love we're having this debate. And I love talking with the history of music, because it's important.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MENDEZ
utterances.sentences: I just think that the list is not the worst thing ever. But I think that like when we're thinking of artists now versus, you know, in 15, 20 years, it's hard to say that they are going to be, you know, the same. Constant -- artists are constantly growing and changing and their places are going to move up and down this list. I don't think that the people are mad that certain people are on this list. I think people are upset there are a lot of people left out.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Can we talk about who's left out?

utterances.speaker: MENDEZ
utterances.sentences: I think -

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Like Celine Dion, Dionne Warwick, who you just interviewed.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Tony Bennett.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: That's -

utterances.speaker: FARLEY
utterances.sentences: Yes, Tony Bennett. A great guy. A great musician. He should be on there.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Alanis Morissette.

utterances.speaker: FARLEY
utterances.sentences: Alanis Morissette's not on there.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: If you're talking about the greatest singers of all time, when you talk about when they -- the way they delivered, the emotion in their voices and just sheer talent, Judy Garland is one of the best singers ever. Where is she? Kelly -- has "Rolling Stone" ever heard Kelly Clarkson sing? They have her at 194. Are you kidding me?

utterances.speaker: MENDEZ
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: FARLEY
utterances.sentences: They left out Sarah Vaughan too. Sarah Vaughan should be on there.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Sarah Vaughan.

utterances.speaker: MENDEZ
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: FARLEY
utterances.sentences: It's weird not to have Sarah Vaughan on a list like this. It's weird not to have Darius Rucker on there.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: FARLEY
utterances.sentences: I know that this tends towards the cool, people - the critics sort of name check. Darius Rucker has never been someone that critics have loved, but he has a great voice.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Why -

utterances.speaker: FARLEY
utterances.sentences: He has a lot of country music awards. He should be on this list.

utterances.speaker: MENDEZ
utterances.sentences: I think definitely someone like Cher. She's like definitely just sort of changed the way that people use auto tune as an artistic choice and not just to correct vocals and stuff like that. But I think someone like Hayley Williams Paramore, she's an incredible vocalist. We have - sorry, I'm blanking, Miley Cyrus, she's incredible. She was just at NBC doing duets with Dolly Parton and Fletcher. There was Brittany Howard from Alabama Shakes, an incredible, incredible vocalist. And - yes, that's all I can think of at the moment (ph).

utterances.speaker: FARLEY
utterances.sentences: And not to mention Harry Bellefonte is not on the list. Someone who I think is a great vocalist. If you -- ask your grandparents about him. He's fantastic.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: FARLEY
utterances.sentences: You know, I - he should be on this list and is not. Paul Robeson, one of the great voices of the early part of the 20th century, not on this list.So, there are a lot of missing things, but just the fact we're able to bring up these voices in this discussion I think shows the list is a good idea, it's good to talk about it, even if the list is missing some key people.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: How did like - I mean, honestly, let's just -- how did Kelly Clarkson is ranked lower than Taylor Swift? I love Taylor Swift and - but it's not possible (ph) how that works.

utterances.speaker: MENDEZ
utterances.sentences: I can maybe give some insight on how that works.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: FARLEY
utterances.sentences: And don't -- don't mess with Taylor Swift. Taylor Swift -

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: No, I love Taylor Swift.

utterances.speaker: FARLEY
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: I'm going to divert us from the -

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: I'm talking about - I'm talking about singing. I'm talking about voices.

utterances.speaker: FARLEY
utterances.sentences: I think she has a - she has a voice that --

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: She's fantastic, but -

utterances.speaker: FARLEY
utterances.sentences: I think communicates the ideas and the emotions that she's singing about.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: All right.

utterances.speaker: FARLEY
utterances.sentences: She's improved over time.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: She writes it. She writes it.

utterances.speaker: FARLEY
utterances.sentences: She's one of the smartest people I've ever interviewed. And she's someone who's taken (INAUDIBLE) and (INAUDIBLE) doing the work.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: That's all well and good but that does -- what does that have to do with singing and voices? Like, I mean, let's - like Elvis.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: I don't know. They -

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: I mean can you compare Elvis to a Luther Vandross? It's like it's not possible.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Wait -

utterances.speaker: FARLEY
utterances.sentences: Luther should be higher. Luther should be higher.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Wait, guys.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Luther - yes.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Wait, guys.

utterances.speaker: FARLEY
utterances.sentences: Luther's too low on this list. Luther should be higher.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Wait, guys. Wait.They said this is not just about voice, originality, influence, depth of catalog, breath. I want you to get in with the final thought on some insight into how they did this list.

utterances.speaker: MENDEZ
utterances.sentences: Yes. So -

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: (INAUDIBLE), by the way. (INAUDIBLE) is not on the list.

utterances.speaker: MENDEZ
utterances.sentences: Exactly. I've done two lists at "Rolling Stone." I did the 70 best Beyonce and 100 best reggaeton (ph) songs of all time.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MENDEZ
utterances.sentences: And basically what we do is we send in a ballot. And based on that ballot, the enter - the people who were entered kind of move up and down the list based on how many are voted on.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: But who votes? Like anyone?

utterances.speaker: MENDEZ
utterances.sentences: There's freelancers, there are staff writers, there are people that they invite from the industry.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: MENDEZ
utterances.sentences: Say like, you know, just experts, critics, anyone that's smart enough to write for this. And then it's sort of a little bit of a mixture of the person who's creating the list and the number of times people are voting for a certain thing.So, then up and down -- it goes up and down the list. And then, at the end, we kind of look at the list and we kind of have a discussion of, you know, this should be higher, this should be lower. But I've never done a staff list because I'm not on staff. And, you know, from there those are kind of different because, you know, everybody has a different leverage on what goes there.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: FARLEY
utterances.sentences: Basically, it's like making a sausage, you don't really want to know what goes on in these (INAUDIBLE).

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Well said.

utterances.speaker: FARLEY
utterances.sentences: We don't want to know.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MENDEZ
utterances.sentences: A very long process.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Two assignments for everyone.So, go back and, if you can find it, watch Luther Vandross' concert from Wembley.

utterances.speaker: FARLEY
utterances.sentences: Lovely fair (ph).

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Amazing.Go and find Judy Garland's the original,  unedited version of Judy Garland at Carnegie Hall. It is - you talk - you want to talk about catalog, delivery, voice, talent, sing, dance, act, all of the above, not on the list.

utterances.speaker: MENDEZ
utterances.sentences: Is there going to be a test later? I don't think -

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Yes. Yes.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: This is something you go - go and look at that.

utterances.speaker: FARLEY
utterances.sentences: (INAUDIBLE).

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Or go look at - if you -- people think about Michael Jackson, they think about the later years, right? Look at him when he was a child performing live on stage and the quality of his voice.

utterances.speaker: FARLEY
utterances.sentences: He's too low on this list, too, Michael Jackson.

utterances.speaker: MENDEZ
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: It's unbelievable.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Eighty-six. Yes.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: So, I can be (ph) Whitney and Aretha, two of my favorite singers, whatever, but, wow.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Control room, what are we going to play to break, Taylor for Don - Taylor for Don.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: (INAUDIBLE).

utterances.speaker: FARLEY
utterances.sentences: Play some SZA (ph). I'm glad she's on the list.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Oh, yes.

utterances.speaker: FARLEY
utterances.sentences: I'm glad she's on the list. I'm glad (INAUDIBLE)'s on the list.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: "Kill Bill." Yes.

utterances.speaker: FARLEY
utterances.sentences: I'm glad they have a lot of - a lot of people like Toots Hibbert of The Maytals. A great reggae artist. They had a lot of great international artists. It's good to see their presence on this list.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: C.J. Farley -

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: What's her name, who died? What's her name? I'm --

utterances.speaker: FARLEY
utterances.sentences: Taio Cruz.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: No, no, a British singer, (INAUDIBLE) -

utterances.speaker: FARLEY
utterances.sentences: Amy Winehouse.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Amy Winehouse.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Oh, yes.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Oh, love her.

utterances.speaker: FARLEY
utterances.sentences: Yes, love her.

utterances.speaker: MENDEZ
utterances.sentences: She should have gone up a lot higher.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: She should have gone up a lot higher.

utterances.speaker: MENDEZ
utterances.sentences: Rosalia was way too low for me, at - like 200, but -

utterances.speaker: FARLEY
utterances.sentences: Thank you.

utterances.speaker: MENDEZ
utterances.sentences: Thank you, guys, so much.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Thank you both. Happy New Year.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Happy New Year.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: President Biden returning to a re-shaped Washington on the eve of Republicans taking over the House.
